H0.text: Cooling the plants is the way the wind helps many plants reproduce.

H1.text: Giving the plants moisture is how the wind helps many plants reproduce.

H2.text: Spreading the plants' pollen is how the wind helps many plants reproduce.

H3.text: Strengthening the plants' root systems is how the wind helps many plants reproduce.

A4.text: Anemophily or wind pollination is a form of pollination whereby pollen is distributed by wind.

A5.text: Anemophilous pollen grains are smooth, light, and non-sticky, so that they can be transported by air currents.
